content:
Hey! When you view your own profile menu, we're currently inconsistent between different options about the pronouns we use to refer to the user. In particular, we mostly use "you" / "yourself", but one option uses "myself":

Screen-Shot-2022-08-22-at-11.52.24-AM.png

In a separate discussion, Vlad Korobov has suggested that we should standardize on "me"/"my"/"myself" in these options. That sounds right to me, as that's what the actions are from the user's perspective -- e.g., I want to "View my profile".

What do folks think?
Yeah, I think "my" is the usual choice in this kind of context.
I'm pretty sure Slack uses "you" and that's the one I first thought of
98d73c71-ac07-4a3a-8fd3-0bfca3ca9695.png
Discord is more inconsistent
82ce6c01-a581-4987-9125-eb16b9f96cd1.png
6a419cc1-3c8e-4f03-a750-c318709c36a6.png

I’m trying to imagine what that would look like if it were “consistently” written from the first-person perspective, though… “This setting allows you to use and process information about how I navigate and use Discord for analytical purposes. For example, it allows you to include me in new feature experiments you test.”??
Perhaps there’s an argument to be made for separating first-person imperative actions from second-person descriptive prose? But I’m worried that line will be blurry and lead to awkward special cases.
Yeah, I've generally preferred using "you" for that reason; "me" can be ambiguous.

Anders Kaseorg said:

I’m trying to imagine what that would look like if it were “consistently” written from the first-person perspective, though…

Interesting point. Definitely for prose like your example it's always IME the user as second person.

I guess we never closed the loop on this. Given the challenges with "my", let's change "View private messages to myself" -> "View private messages to yourself" in the profile summary? Whatever we do, being consistent within a single menu should be better than the current situation.
Yeah, that sounds like a good improvement to me; and one we'll want to do early enough translators can process it.
@Yogesh Sirsat FYI , since it probably makes sense to add a commit to do this if you're updating your PR.

text_change.png

It is not quite fitting there, what should we do here?
[deleted]
Hm, this made me realize we should remember what this option does, which is showing 1:1 PMs with yourself. Neither wording is super-clear that this is what's going on.

Would this fit?

"View messages you sent yourself"

text_fits.png

Yeah, it fits, should I replace this new text in the commit of PR?
Hm, maybe? I "you sent to yourself" would be more clear, but would probably not fit. Sigh.

Just for thought, what would be the scope to change that to something such as "saved messages"? Telegram uses this naming, and it's exactly what I use this feature for, i.e., work related cloud storage.

That's an option, but it might be better to just remove the menu item. We already have a few extra menu items like "Edit profile" and "Go invisible" on your own profile, and the best way to get to that is just clicking on your name in the right sidebar, which is almost always going to be faster than going through this menu.
Dropping the option from your own profile works for me. I don't think that menus is a particularly intuitive way to get to messages to yourself.

Tim Abbott said:

That's an option, but it might be better to just remove the menu item.

Dropping it from the menu does seem like a good idea, helps in de-cluttering too.
"View messages with yourself" might be a cleaner wording.
Yeah, that phrase seems reasonable to me.

I guess we don't have data on how frequently this option actually get used? If it's just very unlikely to be what you want in your own profile menu (and you can click on yourself in the sidebar instead), it might be best to drop it even if we do have decent wording for it.

Generally I think it's good for the UI to be parallel between your own profile and others' profiles, where there isn't a reason it needs to be different.

Some features may be more or less frequently used between your own and other profiles, but I think the parallelism is good for predictability for the user.

Sure, I'm fine with renaming it to "View messages with yourself" and leaving it in.

Tim Abbott will you do that when integrating something, or would it be helpful to get a PR?
It'd be helpful to get a PR.
@Yogesh Sirsat would you be up for putting up a quick PR to do this renaming?
Yeah, here is link #23228.
